name: Augmented Clone KZ-68733-Sigma

systems.flavorDescription: With a quick and calculated twist, lunge, curve, or twitch, the target that thought themselves out of the line of fire suddenly finds themselves squarely within it.
By installing additional armor plating, redundant firing circuits, and enhanced insulation to magazines the longevity of a frame’s armaments can be greatly enhanced.

integratedSystems.flavorDescription: Gained from the Walking Armory: Rank I pilot talent.

weapon.flavorDescription: One basic armament of the WRATH is a one-handed sword, long and hollow, with the center containing a relatively small amount of dense fluid. When swung properly, this fluid moves to the tip, giving the swings far more force and spin than its appearance would suggest.

Anything accelerated with magnetic induction is sure to be hot, including Kinetic penetrators. There are some materials that have a short range but a lot of stopping power. This is no exception. A kinetic penetrator with incredibly high temperature sails through armor, bunkers, and targets like nothing. Derived from pirated SSC Metalmark and Deaths Head weapon designs, the Heckler is a mix of railgun and IPS-N Charged stakes. Except, instead of pinning a foe and shredding them with electric shock, this cuts out the middleman and just shreds through armor. This was one of Mock's earliest designs, but is still dangerously effective, especially given the adaptability of ammunition types it can accelerate. And with the fact it can go through even the biggest target and keep sailing through the other side, this is a nasty piece of work.

Much like GMS mechs, GMS weapons are reliable galactic standards, made using interchangeable parts and built to withstand almost any conditions. There are three lines currently in production.
The Type-I (T-1) line is defined by powerful, reliable, and conventional-kinetic ranged and melee weapons, including the GMS assault rifle, heavy machine gun, shotgun, pistol, and various light and heavy blades. Reliable galactic standards, the GMS T-1 line is the most widely used mech-scale line of weaponry across the galaxy. Echoing the Everest’s design notes, T-1 weapons are simply designed, with few (if any) moving parts, intended to be used in or adaptable to any environment.

bondPowers.name: Tear Throat
bondPowers.description:
You can instantly kill any NPC in arm’s reach of you without rolling, but must first pay the cost. The GM chooses one:
  • You are wracked by guilt and unable to use this ability again until the next session.
  • You take a burden.

bondAnswers: The blood in your past that’s catching up to you.
minorIdeal: I showed someone how it’s done.

armor.flavorDescription: Light hardsuits are usually made from reactive, cloth-like weaves, with limited plating and few powered components to maximize mobility. Like other hardsuits, they can be sealed against vacuum, and protect against a decent amount of radiation and other harmful particles.

weapons.flavorDescription: A weapon dating to the time of the Second Committee, the Nobunaga is a weapon known for a high rate of fire and high power. This weapon fires tungsten slugs at a very high cyclic rate, typically intended for armored targets. However, it works just as well on biological targets...
Medium signature weapons are assault rifles, shotguns, pack-fed lasers, or disruption guns.

gear.flavorDescription:
“Patch” is pilot slang for any kind of modern first aid gear, including sprayable medi-gel and instant-acting medical patches.
Expend a charge to apply a patch to either yourself or an adjacent pilot, restoring half their maximum HP. Patches have no effect on Down and Out pilots.

Dataplating is a general term for any comm-linked jewelry, subdermal netting, wearable jaw, brow, or maxillary plates, etc., that allows subvocal communication and persistent heads-up and augmented reality displays without wearing a helm. Dataplates can quickly translate nearly any language, and allow users to communicate with each other all but silently.

Expend a charge for the following effect:
  • Frag Grenade (Grenade, Range 5, Blast 1): Affected characters must succeed on an Agility save or take 2 Explosive damage.
